title.narrative: Office of Child Labor, Forced Labor, and Human Trafficking (OCFT) - Better Utilization of Skills for Youth (BUSY) through Quality Apprenticeships

description.narrative: The BUSY project will help build the capacity of government, employers, workers' organizations, and civil society actors to establish and expand workplace-based training programs for vulnerable youth, including by identifying gaps in relevant laws and policies.

title.narrative: CAPSA - Capacity Strengthening of Governments to Address Child Labor and/or Forced Labor, and Violations of Acceptable Conditions of Work in Sub-Saharan Africa

description.narrative: The CAPSA project seeks to build the capacity of the government of Kenya and other African governments to more effectively combat child labor, forced labor, and violations of acceptable conditions of work by helping them strengthen enforcement of their laws and regulations, improve assistance services for victims, and improve coordination between law enforcement and social protection entities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Office of Trade and Labor Affairs (OTLA)

description.narrative: The project aims to improve international labor standards and acceptable conditions of work in two key economic sectors through engagement with government, employers, and civil society.
